title: New Ryze optimal build
body:
As we all know Ryze is getting a small rework... he now scales less with mana, more with AP, has less HP, and his ult gives him free CDR.

After hours of thinking I finally came out with the best possible build for him.

Scruffy, do you know if the proposed change to make rune prison stop dashes mid flight went through, like with veigar? Meddler mentioned they were thinking of adding it in a) it's not mentioned in the ability description and b) it seems pretty powerful for a point and click ability to have.

In the end we didn't keep it. Because W has a .25s cast time, combined with the actual time it takes someone to react to seeing a dash, it was really never possible to stop a dash reactively.

That said the stop dash idea was a good one and it is something that we hope to incorporate into a better skill/champ fit sometime in the future.

Is it possible you guys can just code dashes as channels, thus making CC interrupt them mid flight? The only dashes this shouldn't happen to are Ultimate dashes.

Speaking of which, why is Shyvana's the only ultimate dash that can be interrupted!?

Have you considered making a glossary of gameplay terminology? Dashes, blinks, flashes, can all be very confusing for new players, and having to refer to 3rd party websites and other players doesn't seem fair.

Does it have to be reactive cancelling for it to be good?

Like, a major point brought up time and time again with the event horizon changes to begin with was that it had power just by being there.  It didn't necessarily have to hard stun someone to change the way they have to act and create opportunities for Veigar to act.

No, you may not be able to reactively stop it.  But you put up Event Horizon to stop people from getting away now, not to instant stun them.

Singed could be a fine candidate in my opinion.

When I saw the % health change to his Fling on pbe I was honestly a bit disappointed since it buffed a part of him that I felt wasn't needed (and thus making further buffs in his needed areas less likely).

Singed is a champ that really struggles against dashes (and while counters are fine, dashes are a lot more common nowadays).

I'd like to see his Mega adhesive work more like Sorakas Equinox, but only for dashes. So a zone that is to sticky to dash out from (or technically, game code wise it would silence all dash abilities while in it). And perhaps for the reactive part mentioned, could also halt a dash if cast in its travel path.  

A bit off topic for the Ryze thread but the topic of dashes is a hot one for all the older more ms based champions, so figured I'd add my thoughts.

Do you even need Iceborn to cap after this patch?

The mastery page I use for Ryze gets 10% from masteries alone. I don't even need Iceborn.

Yeah, utility Ryze can work, but I prefer taking either 21 offense or 21 defense instead, it just feels better to me somehow. I can see Utility Ryze being really strong, but when I don't need that 10% CDR from masteries anymore (because getting it from an item that already synergies with his spammy kit seems simpler), it seems less appealing of an option over something like 21-9-0, 21-0-9, 9-21-0, or 0-21-9.

The issue for me is, why take 10% CDR from masteries now when it means that the best mana items that doesn't have a redundant passive and doesn't take extra time to stack becomes equally wasteful to getting a second RoA, a Righteous glory, or another tear item? This is one of the few cases where I'd say taking something in masteries actually restricts his viable build options.

I prefer utility Ryze because MS is generally important on him; he's got a longer range skillshot now but he's still fairly short range to really do work (there's a reason most pros take ghost+flash on him in mid). Not to mention his AP ratio's aren't great (they almost got worse; his Q ratio is up but his W and E ratios are down. Of course his mana ratios are also down, but he still felt like he did a ton of damage with a mana build in the PBE custom I played). There are a ton of useful utility masteries that synergize really well with Ryze (like the increased maximum mana, HP regen based on maximum mana, biscuits, extra gold for that third pot to sustain early, etc), the CDR is only one of the reasons to take it.

Tear items don't stack with each other, so it's a huge waste. Righteous glory is not a waste at all; gives him tankiness, mana, *and* more mobility/CC/Sticking power (between ghost, ult, and RG, you pretty much always have a MS steroid available). It's like a perfect item for Ryze.

Ryze is a champion that really needs to hit 40% CDR. Having Frozen Heart as a third core item basically restricted his build path more, imo (I really like RG on Ryze, lol). I think they're also doing this to deincentivize tankier builds of Ryze, make him a slightly squishier battle mage (ie. Vladmir; he gets health from his passive, but generally doesn't build resistances), and less of a ranged fighter/bruiser. This is probably another reason they gave him long range with Q.

I don't think there will be too much of a problem in building Ryze because his mana ratios are getting reduced and his AP ratio on Q is getting increased, and his E will likely do a little bit more damage as well with AP, so buying straight AP items seems a lot better, especially with the increased range on Q.

In particular, I could potentially see Lich Bane being picked up on him for its combination of AP, mana, movement speed, and the passive auto attack enhancer. You wouldn't see this before because Ryze would never get much of a chance to use it because his long combat window meant that he would never apply the Lich Bane'd up auto, but now that he has distinct moments where he doesn't cast spells that fast Lich Bane might see some use for stronger time periods when his passive isn't up. Likewise, Luden's Echo might be really strong for how much synergy his passive has with the speed he casts spells, plus it gives tons of AP for tons of damage and some extra movement speed.

Do you really suggest Iceborn over FH?

I always built it anyway on him instead of FH, since it gives more sticking power, more DPS (Sheen proc in between spells for high mixed damage), more mana, AP, and now, less CDR (which is good). It doesn't give quite as much armor, and it isn't as good against someone like a jinx or Vayne (because no AS slow), but Iceborn is the more aggressive alternative. Now though, with runes and masteries you don't even need Iceborn to cap CDR, meaning you can get a Lich bane instead for some really crazy burst (since his AP ratios are higher and his mana ratios are lower, building him as a tanky mage instead of a magey tank is going to be more ideal.
